metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3846 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw that allowed an attacker to corrupt memory and possibly escalateprivileges was found in the mwifiex kernel module while connecting to amalicious wireless network.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3846` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1043-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1043.46
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1060-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1060.66
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-58.64').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1043.46').
linux-snapdragon package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1060.66').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-25.26~18.04.1').
linux-gke-4.15 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1040.42').
linux-gke-5.0 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1013.13~18.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1040.42').
